subject: Relationships
title: Trust in Government: A Global Decline
description: Learn Trust in Government: A Global Decline in one minute.

hook.text: In 1964, 77% of Americans trusted the government. Today it's 20%. The collapse of political trust has consequences.

buildup.text: Declining trust in government correlates with political polarization, conspiracy theories, and civic disengagement.

discovery.text: Trust erodes when institutions fail repeatedly: corruption scandals, broken promises, and visible incompetence.

twist.text: Low trust is contagious. When you distrust government, you start distrusting media, science, and neighbors too.

climax.text: Democratic societies run on trust. When trust in institutions collapses, democracy itself becomes fragile.

punchline.text: Trust in government fell from 77% to 20%. Democracy needs trust to survive.

quiz.question: What was trust in the US government in 1964 vs. today?
